page.title: 11Employment in Monks Kirby
page.content: Originally the majority of employment in and around the village was provided by the surrounding farms which form part of the Denbigh Estate.Many of the older houses in the village were built to house the people who worked on the Estate and the farms. Today this situation has changed somewhat.Quite a number of the inhabitants of Monks Kirby now find employment outside the village in a number of places some even commute to London.Some work is provided by local pubs and restaurants in Brinklow and nearby Coombe Abbey.The large Rolls-Royce factory also provides employment,although Rugby and Coventry are the main centres of employment. Resident in Monks Kirby are:teachers, farm workers,waterboard officials,Post Office workers various factory workers publicans and a blacksmith.
